messages.title: The CHOICE is CLEAR
messages.content: Gordon Brown's Labour loyalist. Covers a comparison between Labour's approach and Jonathan Mitchell's stance on various local issues.

messages.title: Local Champion Jonathan Mitchell
messages.content: Lists qualities, achievements, and stances of Jonathan Mitchell, emphasizing his local involvement and opposition to Labour's policies.

messages.title: The Conservatives were third last time and can't win here!
messages.content: Suggests that the Liberal Democrats have a better chance of winning in the area against Labour and encourages strategic voting.

messages.title: Is it time for an MP who shares OUR VALUES?
messages.content: Asks the voters if they are ready for a change in representation that aligns more with their values.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Jonathan has campaigned against Labour cuts to local services, including Dulwich Hospital, Dulwich Police Station and local post offices. He is working with local Liberal's in Lambeth to fight Labour's council tax rises and secure investment in West Norwood and Herne Hill.
Jonathan wants to completely change the MP's expenses and the political system. Backs a proportional voting system and enabling people to recall corrupt MPs.
Supports renewable energy products to create local jobs plus infrastructure investments in transport and renewal in home energy plans.

Intent on sculpting a fairer society, tackling issues related to scrap university tuition fees, provide free child care for the first 10,000 days and cut school class sizes to benefit the poorest areas.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Labour's approach and Tony Blair and Gordon Brown's policies are mentioned as a comparison to Jonathan Mitchell's stance.
mentions.tacticalSituation: The leaflet implies a tactical voting consideration, highlighting that the Conservatives were third last time and suggesting that they can't win in the area, asking if it's time for an MP who shares local values.

issues.economy: Supports renewable energy products to create local jobs plus infrastructure investments in transport and renewal in home energy plans.
issues.education: Plans to scrap university tuition fees, provide free child care for the first 10,000 days, and cut school class sizes are mentioned.
issues.environment: Supports plans to create local jobs through renewable energy projects.
issues.governance: Wants to change the political system, including the MP expenses system and backing a proportional voting system enabling people to recall corrupt MPs.

images.caption: Jonathan speaking to a local resident
Jonathan and other Liberal Democrats on the campaign trail

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet puts a strong emphasis on local issues and Jonathan Mitchell's involvement and stance within the community contrasted to Labour's policies. Tactical voting is encouraged by suggesting that Conservative voters may want to consider Jonathan Mitchell, a Liberal Democrat, as Conservatives were third last time and can't win in the constituency.
